poem:
**Sanctuary's Shadow**

In refuge, whispers weave  
across the sea—  
a land of free press, now  
silence treads.  
  
Footsteps echo through  
fogged alleys, unseen—  
once a promise, now  
a plea—  
  
Where the watchful eye  
fails, shadows stand  
in the breach;  
yet voices, unbending,  
rise.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hong Kong activists in Britain should be able to rely on police protection | Letter The UK has become a hunting ground for authoritarian regimes targeting dissidents, journalists and students. It is appalling that Hong Kong activists who sought refuge here met fear, harassment and intimidation from the government they had escaped, only to receive inadequate protection and little coordinated response (Hong Kong democracy campaigner accuses UK police of asking her to ‘self-censor’, 1 August).". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
